chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The main purpose of JavaInsight is to view the content of java bytecode (*.class files) in a disassembled or decompiled form.
JavaInsight comes with two external libraries.

listitem.para: The bytecode disassembling is performed by BCEL (Byte Code Engineering Library) by Markus Dahm markus.dahm@berlin.de. More information about BCEL can be found at http://jakarta.apache.org/bcel.
The decompilation is performed by Jode, a tool written by Jochen Hoenicke jochen@gnu.org. More information about Jode can be found at http://jode.sourceforge.net.

itemizedlist.listitem: Double-click a class to decompile it with Jode.

Right-click to show a popup menu with the following actions:
Decompile with Jode
Decompiles the currently selected class with Jode. Only shown, when a class is selected
Add Archives...
Add a JAR or ZIP file archive to the current classpath.
Classpath View
Switches the tree to classpath view.
Package View
Switches the tree to package view.
Flat Packages
Toggles between flat and hierarchical view of the packages.

chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: To configure JavaInsight, open the Global Options dialog (Utilities> Global Options) and select the entry Plugins> Java Insight.
The following options can be set:

listitem.para: Jode tries to prettify the local variable names. This option is on by default.

term.emphasis: Remove locals, that are used only one time.

listitem.para: Such local variables are defined, but apparently never used. Since they only clutter up the code, they can be removed without problems. Note, that such local variables are only produced by crappy Java compilers; good compilers strip them out anyway. This option is off by default.

This option is meant for obfuscators that "encrypt" strings. Jode tries to recognize encrypted strings and to decrypt them automatically. If activated, Jode searches for expressions like methodX("abc") and assumes that methodX is a decryption routine and "abc" is an encrypted string. It is checked whether methodX is static, final and returns a String. If this is the case, Jode tries to invoke methodX with the constant argument "abc". If successful, Jode replaces the method call with the resulting string. This option is on by default, because it shouldn't do anything harmful.

term.emphasis: Generate imports for packages with more than nnn classes.

listitem.para: Set this to 0, if you don't want to generate imports for whole packages, such as: import java.awt.*; The default is 0.

term.emphasis: Generate imports for classes used more than nnn times.

listitem.para: Set this to 0, if you don't want to generate imports for classes, rather use full qualified class names always. The default is 1.

term.emphasis: Set status of buffer to "saved" after decompile.

listitem.para: Use this if you want to get rid of "Save changes?" messages when you close the decompilation buffer.
